title: [K-12] IoT-Enhanced Technology-Enhanced Learning (TEL) Design: Model-Based Development and Activity Theory Application for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of curriculum design and foundational knowledge of IoT and digital learning tools
context.additional_context: A course supporting pre-service teachers in designing, simulating, implementing, and evaluating IoT-based learning scenarios, including case studies of applications in real-world settings like museums.

learning_goals: Learners can design TEL (Technology-Enhanced Learning) scenarios by combining IoT technology and model-based development.
Learners can analyze interactions between learning environments and tools by applying activity theory.
Learners can track and evaluate learning data using Tin-Can API (xAPI).
Learners can simulate and execute IoT-based learning activities in a blended environment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
